title: Is the bot down?
description: Is the bot down?
body:
If the bot is not responding or providing slow responses, try switching to any of our backup bots which you can find the links for at: https://trojan.app/links

If you've tried every bot and each one is the same, this may be due to Telegram Servers being delegated. Please check-in on our Official Telegram Users Channel to keep updated.

title: How do I take or TP my intials?
description: How do I sell / take my intials?
body: To sell your initials, you simply need to sell 50% of your tokens at 100%+ profit in PnL (Profit and Loss), then you will sell your initials. You can do this with convenience by leveraging Limit Sell Orders or Auto-Sell Orders. You will only be able to see these features in the Telegram bot if you have advanced mode enabled.

title: Why are my transactions so slow?
description: Why are my trade transactions so slow?
body:
We've rolled out a massive swap upgrade which should result in much faster confirmation times.

- You will now either send a Jito bundle or a normal tx, whichever results in the fastest swap time.

- There isn't an "MEV Tip" anymore. Just configure your desired Gas Priority Fee in the settings, and it'll be intelligently applied to your transaction.

To improve the likelihood of your transaction to land and land fast:

- Set a custom tip of .01 or more

- MEV Off

Or if you prefer to ensure MEV Protection turn MEV Protection on.

title: Are bots down nothing is happening when I paste CA in and enter?
description: Are bots down nothing is happening when I paste CA in and enter?
body:
If the bot is not responding or providing slow responses, try switching to any of our backup bots which you can find the links for at: https://trojan.app/links

If you've tried every bot and each one is the same, this may be due to Telegram Servers being delegated. Please check-in on our Official Telegram Users Channel to keep updated.

title: My avg entry is saying I entered my trade much higher than the token price ever got to, why?
description: My avg entry is saying I entered my trade much higher than the token price ever got to, why?
body: This is usually because of MEV Sandwich (Frontrun) attacks. You can refer to dexscreener and filtering by maker then inputting your wallet address to see exactly whats happened. You can also greater help prevent yourself from being MEV'd by enabling MEV Protection in your Settings.

title: What does TP or T/P mean?
description: What does TP or T/P mean?
body: TP or T/P is an abbreviation for Take-Profit limit orders.

title: What does SL or S/L mean?
description: What does SL or S/L mean?
body: SL or S/L is an abbreviation for a Stop-Loss limit order.

title: I'm new to Trojan, how do I get started?
description: I'm new to Trojan, how do I get started?
body: You can easily get started quickly by watching our informative and helpful tutorials on our Official Trojan YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@TrojanOnSolana/videos

title: What are whitelisted wallets?
description: What are whitelisted wallets?
body: Whitelisted wallets are wallets that are whitelisted to be able to trade a specific token.

title: When copytrading, is there a way to prevent emulating multiple buys for one coin?
description: When copytrading, is there a way to prevent emulating multiple buys for one coin?
body: No. Unfortunately you can not set any parameters for the amount of times you will copy buy a from a target wallet.

title: How do I create a new Solana wallet?
description: How do I create a new Solana wallet?
body: You can't new create a Solana wallet on Trojan unless it's your first time using the bot then it will generate a fresh Solana account for you. However, you can always generate a fresh wallet on Phantom, Solflare or Backpack, then import the private key of the newly created wallet into Trojan by leveraging the Import Wallet functionality.

title: I am trying to sell but it fails and gives me this following message - “Your tx might have timed out - check on Solscan”
description: I am trying to sell but it fails and gives me this following message - “Your tx might have timed out - check on Solscan”
body: This sounds like your transaction may have timed out. Please refer to solscan.io and review your recent transactions on-chain to discover what the outcome was. If your transaction timed out, simply retry the transaction again.

title: Why I cant burn my token?
description: Why I cant burn my token?
body: If you can't burn your token, this could be because the token account is frozen therefore cannot be interacted with whatsoever. Otherwise, it's more than likely a network timeout for the burn transaction, if this is the case then simply retry the transaction. Remember, you can only burn up to 10 tokens at a time.

title: Can I send usdt the spl token to trojan bot?
description: Can I send usdt the spl token to trojan bot?
body: Yes, considering its the official USDT SPL token then this can be done since you use any SPL Tokens within Trojan. Though you cannot buy and sell tokens with USDT.

title: Can I see who has used my referral link?
description: Can I see who has used my referral link?
body: No, unfortunately you cannot see the specific users that have used your referral link.

title: Can I find out who initially referred me?
description: Can I find out who initially referred me?
body: No, unfortunately you cannot see who initially referred you to Trojan. There is no way to see who you're paying a portion of your fees to if you don't remember who you were referred by.

title: What is Trojan's Official website?
description: What is Trojan's Official website?
body: https://trojan.app/

title: Is it possible to trade any base coin with Trojan?
description: Is possible to trade any base coin with my Trojan?
body: At present, Trojan only supports Solana SPL Tokens on the Solana Blockchain. Though we are expanding our innovative tools to Ethereum, Base and other EVM chains in the near future.

title: Docs / Documentation?
description: Docs / Documentation?
body: There is no currently official documentation for Trojan, though this in the works. Though there are many helpful resources out there including our Official Telegram Users channel and our help articles: https://intercom.help/trojan-support/en/

title: The bot automatically sold my position/tokens without me doing or pressing anything?
description: The bot automatically sold my position/tokens without me doing or pressing anything?
body: Respond with: "It sounds like you need a member of Trojan Support Team to assist you if you say the bot is automatically selling the token/position for you without your consent, let me get a team member to assist."

title: What does the term 'rug' or 'rugged' mean?
description: What does the term 'rug' or 'rugged' mean?
body: The term 'rug' or 'rugged' refers to scam tokens.

title: My avg entry is below current mcap now, why am I still at a loss?
description: My entry is below mcap now, why am I at a loss?
body: This is because the price of SOL has decreased while the trading position has been open, therefore will slightly inflict PnL (Profit and Loss).

title: How to buy Trojan?
description: How to buy Trojan?
body:
Trojan's token has not yet been released. As always, keep an eye out on the official Trojan Telegram News Channel: @trojan_on_solana_news

Trojan's token has not yet been released. This means that no sort of airdrop has commenced or is commencing as of yet. Nor can you buy any official Trojan token, this will happen in the near future. Any Trojan tokens being made before any announcement in the News Channel/Twitter is a scam.

title: where is Trojan scanner channel?
description: where is Trojan scanner channel?
body: Monitor new Raydium and Pumpfun pools/tokens the instant they get created with the fastest New Pairs scanner on Solana: https://t.me/solanapoolscanner

title: What does this error mean - Program Error: ""Instruction #6 Failed - exceeds desired slippage limit"""
description: What does this error mean - Program Error: ""Instruction #6 Failed - exceeds desired slippage limit"""
body: This means that your configured Slippage has been exceeded. If you frequently encounter timeouts or transaction failures due to "slippage exceeded", consider increasing your slippage percentage.

title: Where can I find Trojan Bot Links?
description: Where can I find Trojan Bot Links?
body: You can find all of our official bot links here: trojan.app/links

title: How to copytrade a sniper?
description: How to copytrade a sniper?
body: Unfortunately, any target wallet using a sniper or any type of custom program cannot be efficiently copytraded.

title: Where can I find new token pairs or new upcoming token launches?
description: Where can I find new token pairs or new upcoming token launches?
body: Monitor new Raydium and Pumpfun pools/tokens the instant they get created with the fastest scanner on Solana: https://t.me/solanapoolscanner

title: How to trade? Any YouTube / Video Tutorials?
description: How to trade? Any YouTube / Video Tutorials?
body: You can watch all of our official tutorials on our official YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@TrojanOnSolana/videos

title: What is a PK?
description: What is a PK?
body: PK is an abbreviation for a Private Key.

title: Can I trade on BASE?
description: Can I use Trojan on BASE?
body: At the current moment, BASE chain is not supported for trading tokens whatsoever. However, we're planning on expanding out bot services to BASE and other EVM chains in the near future.

title: Is there a way to see the full order book for a token within the Trojan bot?
description: Is there a way to see the full order book for a token within the Trojan bot?
body: No, the Trojan bot does not display full order book data. For more detailed market information, you'll need to use external charting and analysis tools like Birdeye, Dexlab and Dexscreener.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on DEXes on other blockchains besides Solana?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on DEXes on other blockchains besides Solana?
body: No, the Trojan bot is specifically designed for the Solana ecosystem. It does not currently support cross-chain trading or trading on DEXes on other blockchains like Ethereum, BSC, or Polygon.

title: What should I do if I suspect someone has gained unauthorized access to my Trojan wallet?
description: What should I do if I suspect someone has gained unauthorized access to my Trojan wallet?
body: If you believe your wallet has been compromised, immediately withdraw all funds to a new, secure wallet. Then, delete your old wallet from the Trojan bot and import the new one. Enable 2FA on your Telegram account for an added layer of security.

title: What happens if I lose my phone or delete the Telegram app? Will I lose access to my Trojan wallet?
description: What happens if I lose my phone or delete the Telegram app? Will I lose access to my Trojan wallet?
body: As long as you have your wallet's private key backed up somewhere safe, you can always regain access to your funds. Simply re-install the Telegram app, start a new chat with the Trojan bot, and import your wallet by importing the backed up private key.

title: What is the maximum number of trades I can execute per day with Trojan?
description: What is the maximum number of trades I can execute per day with Trojan?
body: There is no hard limit on the number of trades you can execute per day. However, keep in mind that each trade will incur a 0.9% (with referral) or 1% (without referral) trading fee, so overtrading can eat into your profits.

title: How can I contact the Trojan team for support or to report a bug?
description: How can I contact the Trojan team for support or to report a bug?
body: The best way to get support is to ask your question in the official Telegram group chat. The team and other helpful community members are active there.

title: What is the difference between limit orders and market orders on Trojan?
description: What is the difference between limit orders and market orders on Trojan?
body: Limit orders allow you to specify a maximum buy price or minimum sell price, and will only execute if the price reaches that level. Market orders execute immediately at the current best available price. Trojan supports both types of orders.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on the Serum DEX?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on the Serum DEX?
body: Yes, the Trojan bot supports trading on all major Solana DEXes, including Serum. Simply use the contract address of the Serum market when creating your trade orders.

title: Is there a way to see how much SOL I've paid in trading fees over time?
description: Is there a way to see how much SOL I've paid in trading fees over time?
body: Currently there is no built-in feature to track total fees paid. However, you can manually calculate your fees by reviewing your trade history and multiplying the total trade volume by the fee percentage (0.9% with referral, 1% without).

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade options or futures contracts?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade options or futures contracts?
body: No, the Trojan bot is designed for spot trading of Solana tokens only. It does not support options, futures, or other derivative contracts.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on leverage/perpetuals?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on leverage/perpetuals?
body: No, the Trojan bot does not currently support leveraged/perpetuals trading. All trades are executed using your available token or SOL balances only.

title: What should I do if my copy trade target cancels or reverses their trade before my trade goes through?
description: What should I do if my copy trade target cancels or reverses their trade before my trade goes through?
body: Unfortunately, it is possible for a copy trade target to reverse their trade faster than your copy trade can execute, resulting in a failed trade. There is no way to completely prevent this, which is why copy trading carries inherent risks.

title: What is front-running and how does Trojan protect against it?
description: What is front-running and how does Trojan protect against it?
body: Front-running is a type of attack where a malicious actor sees a pending transaction and tries to execute their own transaction ahead of it to profit from the price movement. The Trojan bot uses the Jito private mempool to help protect against front-running attacks.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on centralized exchanges like Binance or Coinbase?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on centralized exchanges like Binance or Coinbase?
body: No, the Trojan bot is designed specifically for trading on decentralized exchanges within the Solana ecosystem. It does not support trading on centralized exchanges.

title: Is there a way to set up alerts for specific price levels or percentage changes?
description: Is there a way to set up alerts for specific price levels or percentage changes?
body: Currently, the Trojan bot does not have a built-in price alert feature. However, you can use third-party services like Alertatron or TradingView to set up price alerts for Solana tokens.

title: How often are new features and updates released for the Trojan bot?
description: How often are new features and updates released for the Trojan bot?
body: The Trojan team is constantly working on improving the bot and adding new features. Updates are released regularly, and major new features are announced in the official Telegram channel.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to provide liquidity and earn yield?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to provide liquidity and earn yield?
body: No, the Trojan bot is designed for trading only and does not currently have any liquidity provision or yield farming features.

title: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on PancakeSwap or Uniswap?
description: Can I use the Trojan bot to trade on PancakeSwap or Uniswap?
body: No, currently the Trojan bot only supports trading on decentralized exchanges within the Solana ecosystem, such as Raydium, Jupiter, Meteora and Orca. Support for Ethereum-based DEXes may be added in the future if we were to expand on other chains.

title: Is it possible to use the Trojan bot without giving it access to my main wallet?
description: Is it possible to use the Trojan bot without giving it access to my main wallet?
body: Yes, you can create a separate wallet specifically for use with the Trojan bot, and only deposit the funds you intend to trade with into that wallet. This way, your main holdings remain separate and secure.

title: What happens if I delete the Telegram chat with the Trojan bot? Will I lose access to my funds and my airdrop eligibility?
description: What happens if I delete the Telegram chat with the Trojan bot? Will I lose access to my funds?
body: No, deleting the chat will not affect your funds as long as you have your wallet's private key saved somewhere safe. You can always re-import your wallet with the wallet’s private key that you should have backed up somewhere safe. In regards to airdrop eligibility, it will not impair your allocation whatsoever as long as you have access to the Telegram account it's tied to.

title: How do I deposit funds to my Trojan wallet?
description: How do I deposit funds to my Trojan wallet?
body: To deposit funds, simply send SOL from an exchange or another wallet to the deposit address provided by the Trojan bot when you first set up your wallet. Make sure to send only SOL on the Solana Blockchain, as other tokens are not supported for deposits.

title: Can I copy trade from multiple wallets at the same time?
description: Can I copy trade from multiple wallets at the same time?
body: Yes, the Trojan bot allows you to set up copy trading from up to 40 different wallets simultaneously.

title: What is MEV protection and should I use it?
description: What is MEV protection and should I use it?
body: MEV (Miner Extractable Value) protection helps prevent front-running attacks and sandwich attacks on your trades. It is generally recommended to have MEV protection turned on, although it may slightly increase transaction wait times.

title: What is slippage and how does it affect my trades?
description: What is slippage and how does it affect my trades?
body: Slippage is the difference between the expected price of a trade and the actual price at which the trade is executed. Higher slippage allows for more price fluctuation, which can help trades go through in volatile market conditions.

title: Can I trade any tokens using the Trojan bot?
description: Can I trade any tokens using the Trojan bot?
body: Currently, the Trojan bot only supports trading SPL tokens on the Solana network. Support for other networks like Ethereum and other EVM chains may be added in the future.

title: What should I do if I suspect someone messaging me is a scammer?
description: What should I do if I suspect someone messaging me is a scammer?
body: The Trojan team will never DM you first or call you. If someone messages you claiming to be from the team, they are likely a scammer. Block and report them. Only communicate with the team in the official group chat.

title: What are the fees for using the Trojan bot?
description: What are the fees for using the Trojan bot?
body: The trading fees for the Trojan bot are 0.9% if you signed up using a referral link. Without a referral, the fees are 1%.

title: Can I deposit to Trojan directly from a centralized exchange?
description: Can I deposit to Trojan directly from a centralized exchange?
body: Yes, just send to your Trojan wallet address like any other Solana wallet. Make sure to only send Solana ecosystem tokens (SPL) and leave funds for Trojan gas fees.

title: What does it mean if a token is 'renounced' or 'not renounced'?
description: What does it mean if a token is 'renounced' or 'not renounced'?
body: Renounced means the token creator has given up control of the contract so they can no longer make changes. Non-renounced means they maintain control. Renounced is seen as safer.

title: Is it safe to leave funds in my Trojan wallet long term?
description: Is it safe to leave funds in my Trojan wallet long term?
body: While Trojan uses encryption, it's always safest to only leave in the bot what you are actively trading with. Store the bulk of your funds in a cold wallet you control the keys to.

title: How can I see how much profit I've made copying a wallet?
description: How can I see how much profit I've made copying a wallet?
body: There's no automatic PNL tracking for copy trades yet. You can refer to solscan and look at your sol balance changes with each transaction. Though, a tracking feature is on our to-do list

title: Why do I keep getting 'price impact too high' when I try to buy?
description: Why do I keep getting 'price impact too high' when I try to buy?
body: It means your buy amount is a large portion of the token's liquidity. Either reduce your amount or increase slippage (be careful of scams with this though).

title: What is 'slippage exceeded' error?
description: What is 'slippage exceeded' error?
body: It means the price moved more than your slippage setting allowed between placing the order and it being executed. Increase your slippage and retry.

title: Is there a way to automatically follow another wallet's trades?
description: Is there a way to automatically follow another wallet's trades?
body: Yes, that's what the copy trading feature is for. Use our Copy Trade feature and enter the wallet address you want to copy.

title: My trade failed but I still paid a fee, is that normal?
description: My trade failed but I still paid a fee, is that normal?
body: Yes, even for failed transactions the gas fee is consumed because the validation attempt still happens on the blockchain.

title: What does it mean if a token is 'unsupported' and how can I sell it?
description: What does it mean if a token is 'unsupported' and how can I sell it?
body: Unsupported usually means it is a scam token that blocks selling. You likely cannot sell it through any normal means. Best to consider that money lost and be more careful in the future.

title: Is it possible to partially sell a position, like only 25%?
description: Is it possible to partially sell a position, like only 25%?
body: Yes, use the sell function and enter 25% for the amount. You can also set partial sells with Limit Sell or Auto Sell.

title: Why did my trade go through at a much higher price than I wanted?
description: Why did my trade go through at a much higher price than I wanted?
body: This is likely due to an MEV bot frontrunning your order. To avoid this, enable MEV protection in Settings.

title: Is it possible to snipe a token as soon as liquidity is added?
description: Is it possible to snipe a token as soon as liquidity is added?
body: Sniping exactly at liquidity add is very difficult without botting. The closest on Trojan is to set up an order by leveraging our Auto Buy feature or keep trying until it goes through.

title: What does 'Price Impact Too High' mean?
description: What does 'Price Impact Too High' mean?
body: It means your order size is a large percentage of the token's liquidity and may cause a significant price change.

title: Is there a maximum amount I can trade on Trojan?
description: Is there a maximum amount I can trade on Trojan?
body: There is no maximum amount you can trade.

title: How long does a withdrawal from Trojan usually take?
description: How long does a withdrawal from Trojan usually take?
body: Withdrawals are usually very fast, within a few seconds. If your withdrawal is pending for a long time, check on Solscan.io to see if the transaction is confirmed.

title: What is slippage and how does it affect my trades?
description: What is slippage and how does it affect my trades?
body: Slippage is the price difference between your order and the actual execution price. A low slippage means your order may fail if prices move quickly. Higher slippage allows for more price movement but you may get a worse fill price.

title: How do I enable or disable the trade confirmation screen?
description: How do I enable or disable the trade confirmation screen?
body: Go to Settings and toggle the 'Confirm Trades' option to off. When enabled, you have to manually confirm each order. Disabled means orders go through with one click.

title: What's the easiest way to check my wallet transactions?
description: What's the easiest way to check my wallet transactions?
body: You can use a Solana block explorer such as Solscan. Paste your public wallet address and you can see all your transaction history.

title: Can I set multiple take profit targets for a token I hold?
description: Can I set multiple take profit targets for a token I hold?
body: Yes, by leveraging our limit sell feature you can set multiple sell orders at different profit targets. For example: 25% at 2x, 25% at 3x, 50% at 5x.

title: Why do I need SOL in my wallet for copy trading?
description: Why do I need SOL in my wallet for copy trading?
body: Even though you are copying trades, each buy/sell still happens from your own wallet. So you need SOL to pay for the transaction fees.

title: How can I buy tokens that are newly listed on PumpFun?
description: How can I buy tokens that are newly listed on PumpFun?
body: First get the token contract address from PumpFun. Paste that into the Trojan bot and set your amount and gas. Submit the order quickly once liquidity is added.

title: Is it safe to share my Trojan wallet address publicly?
description: Is it safe to share my Trojan wallet address publicly?
body: Your public wallet address can be shared safely as it is used to receive funds. Never share your private key as that gives full access to your wallet.

title: How do referral payouts work on Trojan?
description: How do referral payouts work on Trojan?
body: You earn 10% of the fees paid by each user who signs up with your referral link. You also earn from your referrals’ referrals! Payouts are automatically sent to your wallet every 24 hours if the amount exceeds 0.0015 SOL, otherwise you’re ineligible for a payout on that particular day.

title: What's the advantage of using Trojan over trading directly on a DEX?
description: What's the advantage of using Trojan over trading directly on a DEX?
body: Trojan offers advanced features like stop loss, limit orders, copy trading, auto sell and more. It helps you trade much faster and smarter compared to manual clicking on DEX.

title: Is copy trading just as fast as manual trading?
description: Is copy trading just as fast as manual trading?
body: Copy trading is slightly slower than manual because the bot can only place the order after detecting the original trade. For fast moving tokens, use a higher slippage for copy trades.

title: How soon will the Trojan token launch and how can I buy it?
description: How soon will the Trojan token launch and how can I buy it?
body: The token launch date is still unannounced.

title: My copy trading isn't working, what could be wrong?
description: My copy trading isn't working, what could be wrong?
body: Ensure the wallet you are copying is actively trading. Check your slippage and gas settings match the wallet. Some wallets that use snipers or other custom programs can't be copied.

title: Are limit orders still active if I close the Telegram app?
description: Are limit orders still active if I close the Telegram app?
body: Yes, your limit orders remain active on the bot even if you are offline. They will trigger once the price condition is met.

title: Is there a way to see my all-time total PNL and volume traded on Trojan?
description: Is there a way to see my total PNL and volume traded on Trojan?
body: You can check your stats on the Dune analytics dashboard: https://dune.com/whale_hunter/trojan-trading-bot

title: Can I copy trade someone who is trading on PumpFun?
description: Can I copy trade someone who is trading on PumpFun?
body: Yes, Trojan supports copy trading for PumpFun. Just paste the wallet address into the bot as usual.

title: My transaction keeps failing, what could be the issue?
description: My transaction keeps failing, what could be the issue?
body: The most common causes are insufficient slippage or low gas settings. Increase your slippage and use the Fast or Turbo or even better Custom Gas at 0.01 SOL, then retry.

title: How can I burn junk tokens in my wallet?
description: How can I burn junk tokens in my wallet?
body: Go to Settings > Show/Hide Tokens > Burn. Select the tokens you want to burn (up to 10 at a time). You will get back around 0.002 SOL per token burned.

title: I got a message from someone claiming to be Trojan support, is it legit?
description: I got a message from someone claiming to be Trojan support, is it legit?
body: No, it is a scam. Trojan admins will never DM or call you first. Only contact admins through the official Trojan Telegram group.

title: Can I send tokens other than SOL to my Trojan wallet?
description: Can I send tokens other than SOL to my Trojan wallet?
body: Yes, you can send any SPL token to your Trojan wallet address. Make sure to leave some SOL for gas fees though.

title: What is the MEV protection setting and should I enable it?
description: What is the MEV protection setting and should I enable it?
body: MEV protection helps prevent your transaction from being frontrun by bots. It is recommended to enable it, especially when trading low liquidity tokens.

title: How do I participate in the Trojan token airdrop?
description: How do I participate in the Trojan token airdrop?
body: Airdrop details are still to be announced. The best way to maximize your airdrop eligibility is to actively use the bot for trading and refer other users with your referral link.

title: What's the difference between the Fast, Turbo and Custom gas settings?
description: What's the difference between the Fast, Turbo and Custom gas settings?
body: Fast has a gas tip of 0.0015 SOL, Turbo is 0.0075 SOL. Custom allows you to set your own gas tip amount. Higher tips help your transaction confirm faster.

title: Will changing my Telegram username affect my referral link or airdrop eligibility?
description: Will changing my Telegram username affect my referral link or airdrop eligibility?
body: No, your referral link and airdrop are tied to your unique Telegram account ID which does not change even if you change your username.

title: I accidentally sent my tokens to the wrong address, can I get them back?
description: I accidentally sent my tokens to the wrong address, can I get them back?
body: Unfortunately, transactions on the blockchain are irreversible. If you sent to the wrong address, try contacting the receiver if possible, but recovery is unlikely.

title: How do I know if my referral link is working?
description: How do I know if my referral link is working?
body: Your referral link is tied to your Telegram account ID, not your username. Any users who sign up with your link will be counted, and you can see your referral stats in the “Referrals” section in the bot.

title: Can I use Trojan to trade on the Ethereum network?
description: Can I use Trojan to trade on the Ethereum network?
body: Not yet, Trojan currently only supports the Solana network. Although we plan on expanding to Ethereum and EVM chains in the near future. The Ethereum wallet you see in the interface is only used for bridging at the moment.

title: Is there a way to unhide tokens that I previously hid?
description: Is there a way to unhide tokens that I previously hid?
body: Yes, go to Settings > Show/Hide Tokens and you can unhide any tokens you previously hid from your positions.

title: How do I set up copy trading on Trojan?
description: How do I set up copy trading on Trojan?
body: Go to the copy trading menu and enter the wallet address you want to copy. Make sure you have enough SOL balance for fees and adjust your slippage settings accordingly.

title: How are the Trojan admins/mods selected and verified?
description: How are the Trojan admins/mods selected and verified?
body: The core team carefully vets and trains our admins/mods.

title: Will Trojan support Solana's upcoming BTC or stablecoin integration?
description: Will Trojan support Solana's upcoming BTC or stablecoin integration?
body: Yes, Trojan intends to integrate and provide trading access to any major new Solana program deployments like synthetic BTC.

title: What is the process for reporting bugs or vulnerabilities?
description: What is the process for reporting bugs or vulnerabilities?
body: Potential bugs or vulnerabilities can be responsibly reported in the official Trojan Telegram group, which the team actively monitors.

title: How liquid is the market for the upcoming Trojan’s token?
description: How liquid is the market for the upcoming Trojan’s token?
body: Liquidity details like launch market cap, vesting schedules, exchange listings etc. are still to be determined and announced.

title: What data does Trojan log and is my activity private?

title: What is MEV Protection / Anti-MEV?
body:
MEV Protection (JITO Slots) ensure that your transaction will be private and can't be attacked by MEV bots. By leveraging MEV Protection your transaction can't be detected in mempool to be frontrun.

How to activate MEV Protection:

Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings".

In Settings menu you can enable MEV Protect (Buys) and (Sells) separately, after its activated you can specify "Gas Tip".

Note: Approximately only 30% of Validators provide MEV Protected pvt tx (JITO Slots), which is why it can slow down your transaction speed.

title: What is MEV bot?
body:
MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) in cryptocurrency refers to the profit that someone can make by strategically ordering, including, or excluding transactions in a blockchain block. Essentially, it's about smartly manipulating transaction orders to earn extra money beyond the usual rewards for validating blockchain actions. MEV bots automate this process, finding and executing these profitable opportunities automatically. MEV bots are commonly referred to as sandwich bots.

What is MEV:

To be protected consider MEV Protection (JITO Slots), to ensure that your transaction will be private and can't be attacked by MEV bots.

How to activate MEV Protection:

Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings".

In Settings menu you can enable MEV Protect (Buys) and (Sells) separately, after its activated you can specify "Gas Tip".

Note: Approximately only 30% of Validators provide MEV Protected pvt tx (JITO Slots), which is why it can slow down your transaction speed.

title: What is recommended slippage?
body:
There is no recommended slippage.

Before making a transaction, make sure you are aware of Price Impact and tokens volatility before taking a trade.

- If your token's price is more stable and not as volatile, please use tighter slippage i.e. 5% or lower.

- If the price volatility is high and the price jumps up and down in seconds, consider all risks and use higher slippage settings. Our default slippage is 15%.

When you start the bot for the first time, the standard/defaulted slippage is set to 15%. Please adjust the slippage to your token's volatility, sometimes you have to adjust slippage in trades you are taking.

title: What is slippage?
body:
Slippage is a users tolerance for price change during the execution of a transaction.

Slippage is a key consideration when trading on Solana for a number of reasons.

1. Transaction speed;

2. Smaller overall liquidity;

3. MEV protection considerations.

By default, slippage is set to 15%. We figured out this number by looking at lots of trades. But you can change it to fit how you like to trade. If your trades are taking too long or not going through because of slippage, you might want to raise the slippage setting.

title: Why I spend more on Gas than I set in settings?
body:
When you transact you have basic network gas fee (~0.002 SOL per Swap) + Gas Tip you defined in Settings. Gas tip applies to MEV Protection if enabled.

These Gas Fees are paid to Solana Network Validators!

We have 3 types of gas adjustments:

- FAST: 0.0015 SOL (by default)

- TURBO: 0.0075 SOL

- CUSTOM: your custom amount

You can click on the predefined ones FAST or Turbo, alternatively you can click "Custom", you will be prompted to specify gas tip you are willing to set.

Note: Higher Priority Gas paid helps you to bid for higher priority in queue among other traders. Transactions with higher priority fees are more likely to be confirmed quickly by the network, as they are given priority over transactions with lower priority fees.

title: How to adjust Gas Tip?
body:
Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings", on the upper side of the settings menu you will see the gas adjustment buttons.

We have 3 types of gas adjustments:

- FAST: 0.0015 SOL

- TURBO: 0.0075 SOL

- CUSTOM: your custom amount. it can be as low as 0.0005

You can click on the predefined ones FAST or Turbo, alternatively you can click "Custom", you will be prompted to specify gas tip you are willing to set.

Higher Priority Gas paid helps you to bid for higher priority in queue among other traders. Transactions with higher priority fees are more likely to be confirmed quickly by the network, as they are given priority over transactions with lower priority fees.

title: Copy Sells: "A" trader bought "X" token and "B" trader sold his "X" token?
body:

Example:

- "A trader" bought 100 WIF tokens

- "B trader" bought 100 WIF tokens

You copy bought 100% from each trader, 200 WIF tokens

"B trader" sold 100 WIF tokens (100%), you copy sold all 200 WIF tokens (100%)

Note: Multi-wallet will be incorporated soon to avoid it.

title: What if i enable Copy Sell and Auto Sell?
body:
Copy Sell and Auto Sell can be enabled at the same time in Copy Trading.

It works without priority and it is based on which comes first.

- If copied trader sells first before your Auto Sell order is triggered - Copy Sell will be executed.

- If Auto Sell order is triggered first then Auto Sell order will be executed.

title: What happens if I delete the Trojan Bot I'm using?
body:
Effects of Deleting a Bot:

  1. Continuity of Services:

    • Deleting a bot will not affect your trades. Trades, including copy trades, limit orders, and DCA orders, will continue as normal. Your wallet remains intact, and accessing the bot again will restore all your previous settings and trades.

  2. Notifications Handling:

    • Notifications will be sent to the last bot you used. If you engage in copy trading or have active DCA/limit orders, ensure that you do not block this bot without first interacting with another one.

  3. Trade Management Across Multiple Bots:

    • Running several bots simultaneously will not duplicate your trades. You can open and switch between multiple bots at any time without initiating trades multiple times.

title: Why my trader is in profit and i'm not?
body:
When Copy Trading you may notice a difference between your and copied wallets trades. Delay is normal and its not possible to front-run or copy the same block.

Difference between entries and exits can be vital when copy trading this is why its not suggested to copy trade snipers. Snipers buy first blocks and get the best possible entries when you buy top of the candle after them, then they sell significant portion of supply causing price drop where your sell order gets filled, same idea when copy trading "whales".

if they make 1,000% in 10 seconds you may end up with a loss of -30% simply due to the fact who you copy trade.

Another important suggestion is to not copy trade high intensity scalpers who make a lot of trades in short period of time, you may end up losing.

Choose who you copy trade wisely.

title: Withdrew token and my PnL is wrong
body:
If you withdrew token and you see in Positions wrongly displayed PnL its due to calculations our system has, it cannot see or verify token withdrawals or deposits to calculate PNL correctly.

Example: i bought 100 tokens for 100$, price stayed the same but i withdrew 50 tokens, system sees it as a change of value for your token

100 tokens = 100$

50 tokens = 50$

if you withdrew 50 tokens it sees it as a loss of 50$ or -50% (if price stays unchanged) or what you spent on acquiring those tokens is only worth half since you withdrew half.

title: Deposited token and can't see PnL
body: If you deposit token to Trojan Wallet, you can see it in Positions menu and sell it, but PnL cannot be calculated by Trojan due to the fact that its bought outside Trojan and its not registered as a purchase in Trojan.

Our Price Feed custom built monitor follows data in live time.

Interval: 1 min

Duration: 10 min

10 Intervals total ; Each interval - 5% of tokens

Example 2: No duration

Each interval - 50% of tokens ; active until all tokens are sold

title: My entry price is higher than the actual price on DEX, why?
body:
Understanding Why Your Entry Price is Higher Than the Market Price on a DEX:

Cause: MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) Attacks:

MEV attacks, including Sandwich attacks by MEV bots, occur when these bots front-run trades on the network. They execute orders just before yours, purchasing at a lower price.

Effect on Your Trades:

These bots then use your trade to exit at a higher price, which results in you entering the trade at an inflated price.

The MEV bot completes its trade by selling immediately after you enter, further impacting your entry price.

Protection Measures:

To safeguard against MEV attacks, you can enable MEV Protection in your Bot Settings. This feature helps to ensure you are not exploited by MEV bots and improves your trading conditions.

title: Timed Out
body:
If you get a Timeout notification you can confirm on Solscan.io by searching your bot wallet address whether the transaction was successful. If your transaction was not successful please retry.

Timeout's usually happen when there is network congestion and transactions take longer than 1.5 minutes.

- If you are using MEV protection, consider increasing Gas Tip or disable MEV Protection in Settings. Its likely to happen if JITO is experiencing issues.

- If you have Bolt Pro, consider increasing Gas Tip in Settings or disable Bolt Pro in Settings.

title: Copy Trading: Insufficient balance for gas
body:
Failure "Insufficient balance for gas" when copy trading.

This is common error indicating that you don't have enough SOL on your balance to pay network gas fees.

- Deposit more SOL to your wallet balance, try to keep at lease 0.02 SOL for gas fees at all times to ensure you won't get stuck in a middle of the trade.

- Decrease Gas Tip in Copy Trading if you need to sell urgently by giving it as little value as possible. For example: 0.0001

To change Gas Tip go to main menu (type /start) > click Settings and decrease Gas tip, "✅ Fast 🐴 " or custom.

Go to "Copy Trade" section from menu (type /start), choose trader and change Buy or Sell Gas to ensure you will have enough for gas fees in the future.

- If you are buying and see this error choose lower amount of purchase or decrease Gas Tip.

Go to Main Menu (type /start) and click "Copy Trade", from there you can manage all wallets as well as click pause selected wallets.

Choose wallet you want to pause, then click on 'Active' toggle to enable or disable copy trading the selected wallet.

🟢 Green means, copy trading is enabled

🟠 Orange means, copy trading is paused

Alternatively you can simply remove the target wallet if you don't want to copy trade

that specific wallet anymore.

title: Can I change my referrer?
body: Your Referrer is set permanently and cannot be changed.

title: What is a Priority Fee?
body:
Higher Priority Gas paid helps you to bid for higher priority in queue among other Snipers. Transactions with higher priority fees are more likely to be confirmed quickly by the network, as they are given priority over transactions with lower priority fees.

Note: If you want to snipe hyped launch and compete with other snipers, paying higher priority gas fees is mandatory.

title: Can I cancel a snipe? N/A
body: To cancel Scheduled Snipe it has to be at least 2 minutes prior to scheduled launch. Otherwise snipe will happen as normal and funds can't be withdrawn.

title: Market cap is different than on DEX
body:
If you see that Market Cap is different and not as on DEX, it is normally because our Price Feed is ahead and DEX (Dexscreener, Birdeye, Dextools) and delayed.

Verify by refreshing Positions monitor and compare it to DEX, you may notice that seconds after our monitor is at certain price - DEX follows.

If you see a large difference, go to Solscan.io and search token by pasting its Contract Address, multiply [ token supply x token price ] to calculate Market Cap, in 99.9% of cases our Market cap is correct.

title: My Limit Order filled at a different price.
body:
Market Price Execution:

Limit Orders are executed at the market price, which can fluctuate at the time of triggering. The final fill price depends on the slippage settings you have chosen.

Slippage Impact:

For example, if your slippage is set to 10% and the trigger price is $1, the order can fill at any price between $0.90 (lowest possible) and $1.10 (highest possible). This range shows that a slight variation in the fill price is normal.

High Slippage and Volatility:

If your order fills at a significantly lower price and you've set high slippage, this could occur due to extreme market volatility or if your transaction was front-run by an MEV bot, especially if MEV Protection is not enabled.

title: My Limit Order didn't trigger
body:
Troubleshooting: Why My Limit Order Didn't Trigger

Check Order Status:

Ensure that your Limit Order is active and properly created.

Confirm Price Settings:

Verify that the Trigger Price or Market Cap is accurately set.

Validate Market Data:

Use Dexscreener.com to confirm whether the market price or market cap you set was indeed reached.

Examine Price Movements:

Check the 1-second chart to ascertain that your trigger point was truly met and not just a temporary fluctuation caused by an MEV bot.

Further Assistance:

If you are still uncertain, contact our support team via chat for further assistance.

title: Supported Pools
body:
Supported Pools on Trojan on Solana:

Directly Supported Pools:

Trojan directly supports Raydium AMM, Raydium CLMM, and Meteora on the Solana network.

Indirectly Supported Pools:

Orca and FluxPools are supported through Jupiter once they are listed. Typically, Jupiter lists these pools approximately 5-7 minutes after their launch.

Future Updates:

Direct support for Orca and FluxPools is planned and will be available soon.


​

title: Can I a set Limit order on  an asset before trading starts?
body:
In order to create Limit order asset must be tradable, otherwise you can't create an order.

We suggest you to consider LP Sniper in case if you want to buy token at launch as quickly as possible.

title: DCA Order is executing a different amount than I set
body:
A common misunderstanding with DCA Buy Orders is that the amount you set is for the entire order, and it's divided across all intervals throughout the duration you specify.

Example 1:

Amount: 1 SOL

Interval: 1 min

Duration: 10 min

10 Intervals total ; Each interval - 0.1 SOL

Example 2:

Amount: 1 SOL

Interval: 1 min

Each interval - 1 SOL until order is closed

title: My Limit Order filled at different price
body:
Limit Orders when triggered are executed at Market Price and price can fluctuate. your order will rely on slippage settings you set.

Example: Slippage is 10% ; triggered at price of 1$ ; lowest possible fill price - 0.9$ ; highest possible fill price - 1.1$

Based on example above we can see that price can be slightly different and its normal.

If you used high slippage and price of purchase was way too high, it can happen if price is extremely volatile or you don't use MEV Protection and you got front ran by MEV bot.

title: My Limit Order didn't trigger
body:
If your Limit Order didn't trigger you have to verify:

  1. Limit Order is created and its Active.

  2. Verify that Trigger Price or Market Cap is set correctly.

  3. Head to Dexscreener.com and verify that price or mcap you set has actually been hit.

  4. Verify on 1s chart that trigger point was actually reached and it wasn't MEV bot wick.

Still unsure?

- Send a message to our support via chat and we will be happy to assist you!

title: Failed to Fetch Quote
body:
Due to network congestion the fetching of the price on both chains simultaneously may be delayed causing this issue. Please retry.

You can also encounter Failed to Fetch Quote when you are trying to withdraw less than minimum required.

Please verify on https://swap.mayan.finance/ and account for bridge gas fees!

title: Bridge was successful but my funds are missing
body:
ETA for Bridge to be successfully completed and funds to arrive is 18-35 minutes.

You can see status of your bridge transaction on our providers website: https://swap.mayan.finance/

Please be advised that sometimes, when there is network congestion, the fetching of the data provided by the chain explorers like Etherscan.io and Solscan.io may be delayed.

Refresh your positions menu or restart the bot. If you are still facing same issue and you can't see your balance updated please contact our support!

If after displayed ETA funds weren't credited please contact our support in chat.

title: Bridge Provider
body: We are using a third-party bridge provider https://swap.mayan.finance/ which is powered by Wormhole.com and Solana Network.

title: Which assets can I bridge?
body:
We support only following bridge transactions at the moment between Solana Network and ETH Mainnet (erc20).

- ETH > SOL

- SOL > ETH

title: How can I Bridge?
body:
Go to main menu(type /start) and click on "Bridge", from Bridge menu you can copy wallet addresses to deposit assets to bridge.

  1. Choose the bridge direction ETH > SOL or SOL > ETH.

  2. You can bridge all your ETH/SOL balance or adjust a custom amount (click Custom).

  3. Choose the speed of the bridge transaction by clicking on "Cheapest" or "Fastest".

  4. Click on "Bridge" to initiate the transaction.

Note: Normally minimum bridge amount is 0.02 ETH or 0.5 SOL. The bridging transaction may take up to 35 min.

Note: Alternatively you can use command [ /unhide "CA" ] to easily unhide token you want.

title: Auto Sell
body:
If you enable Auto Sell it will create Limit - Take Profit and/or Stop Loss on all purchases made when its active. Auto Sell must be "🟢 ON" to work on tokens you buy. It doesn't work on all tokens you hold.

To activate and create Auto Sell go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings", then click on "Auto Sell".

How to add Take Profit:

- Click on "Add Order" to define a custom "Take Profit (T/P)"

To create a Take Profit click on "T/P" and provide with Take Profit target (x% change).

Example: 100%

- Click on "Amount" next to "T/P" and provide with % of tokens you want it to sell.

Example: 50%

- We created an order to Sell 50% of tokens when your holding reaches 100% of profit.

(i.e. takes out your initial)

Important: Amount of tokens you are holding is 100% and all Take Profit orders amount together must add up to a maximum of 100% across all Take Profit Orders! Amount can't exceed 100%!

How to add Stop Loss:

- Click on "Add Order" to define a custom "Stop Loss (S/L)"

To create a Stop Loss click on "T/P" and provide with Stop Loss target (-x% change).

Example: -50%

- Click on "Amount" next to "T/P" and provide with % of tokens you want it to sell.

Example: 100%

- We created an order to Sell 100% of tokens if price goes down -50%.

Important: Amount of tokens you are holding is 100% and all Stop Loss orders amount together must add up to a maximum of 100% across all Take Profit Orders! Amount can't exceed 100%!

Finally, define Slippage for your Auto Sell limit orders and and click "🔴 OFF" to activate Auto Sell.

- 🟢 ON - Auto Sell is enabled

- 🔴 OFF - Auto Sell disabled

We successfully created Auto Sell with Take Profit and Stop Loss orders!

title: Auto Buy
body:
When Auto Buy is enabled it will immediately buy any token or token address sent to the bot with predefined parameters to let you move quickly into trades. You can use Auto Buy with Auto Sell to build your own trading strategy!

Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings", then press on "Auto Buy".

  1. Click "Buy Amount" and set your pre set buy amount that will be used for each attempted buy when Auto Buy is enabled.

  2. Set your own Slippage by clicking on "Slippage", it will prompt to answer with desired Slippage.

  3. Set Minimum Liquidity parameters to limit transaction with low liquidity

  4. Set Maximum Market Cap parameters to Limit transactions with market cap exceeding your strategy.

  5. Click "🔴 OFF" to enable Auto Buy

- 🟢 ON - Auto Buy enabled

- 🔴 OFF - Auto Buy disabled

title: MEV Protection Tip
body:
MEV Protection Tip or JITO tip is used on each MEV Protected swap you do.

Your preferred MEV Tip is defined by Gas Tip in Settings.

- Fast - 0.0015 SOL (default)

- Turbo - 0.0075 SOL

- Custom - custom amount of SOL

Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings".

In Settings menu you can enable MEV Protect (Buys) and (Sells) separately, after its activated you can refer to settings and configure your Gas Tip as mentioned above.

Note: Approximately only 30% of Validators provide MEV Protected pvt tx (JITO Slots), which is why it can slow down your transaction speed.

What is MEV?:

title: MEV Protection
body:
MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) in cryptocurrency refers to the profit that someone can make by strategically ordering, including, or excluding transactions in a blockchain block. Essentially, it's about smartly manipulating transaction orders to earn extra money beyond the usual rewards for validating blockchain actions. MEV bots automate this process, finding and executing these profitable opportunities automatically.

MEV Protection (JITO Slots) ensure that your transaction will be private and can't be attacked by MEV bots.

How to activate MEV Protection:

Go to main menu (type /start) and click on "Settings".

In Settings menu you can enable MEV Protect (Buys) and (Sells) separately, after its activated you can specify " Gas Tip" - Fast 0.0015 , Turbo 0.0075 or Custom

Note: Approximately only 30% of Validators provide MEV Protected pvt tx (JITO Slots), which is why it can slow down your transaction speed.

What is MEV:

title: What to look for in New Pairs?
body:
1. Renounced: ✅ means dev can't mint more tokens or freeze your account

    Renounced: ❌ means dev can mint more tokens and freeze your account

  2. Not Rugged: ✅ means token not rugged yet

    Rugged❗️means it's rugged and you must avoid it

  3. Liquidity: Value of LP in dollars, ideally it should be 1:1 to Market Cap ratio or below.

  4. Locked: How much LP is locked, 100% is preferable.

  5. LP: % of tokens paired in LP, ideally it should be 80-100%, it does't indicate that token is safe.

  6. Creator: % of tokens held by the dev.

  7. Top 5/Top 20: Token distribution across top 5/20 holders. The less % they hold, the better the distribution is. The better it is for a token.

Trading Live: Countdown timer for the trading to be enabled on token.

Note: These are all technical tips. Make sure to look out for the community, meta, originality of the project, hardworking development team which are key for the project's success! New Pairs are very volatile and considered extremely risky.

Do you own research!

title: Copy Trading: A buy wasn't copied.
body:
Copy Trade buys, troubleshooting:

- Confirm you’ve activated the copy trade module by clicking ➕Add.

- Confirm you have the appropriate target wallet set up

- Review Solscan.io to ensure your target wallet is trading in supported pools.

- Supported pools: Raydium AMM, CLMM, Meteora and Jup Routed Trades.

- Unsupported pools: Directly through ORCA, or Flux

- Check solscan.io to ensure you are not copying a sniper or custom program.

- Open a buy transaction in legacy mode.

- If you see “Interact with System Program” you cannot copy this wallet.

- Only copying sells? Review for custom program in a buy tx.

- Confirm it was not a token transfer/airdrop.

Why can’t I copy a sniper?

- Proper snipers bots spam 100s to 1000s of txs and cannot be copied.

- Snipers often leverage custom programs that cannot be copied.

Why can’t I copy a custom program?

- we don't support copy trading custom programs, because they can be malicious and fake swaps in order to exploit copy trading bots.

- it is likely if you’re copying an individual using a custom program to buy, you will copy sells because they are selling directly through a copiable setup.

title: Copy Trading: Common Issues
body:
List of Common issues you can encounter when Copy Trading.

1. Slippage Exceeded:

- up your slippage settings in your copy trade module.

- To what?

- Consider increasing 3-5% at a time until it doesn’t fail.

- Work back down 1-2% at a time from there.

- Review and ensure you’re not trying to copy a sniper (see below).

2. Copy Trade is slow to execute:

- Check your settings.

- Is your gas tip high enough? Turbo (.0075) or higher recommended.

- Ensure you are not attempting to copy a sniper.

- Use Dexscreener.com to identify when the wallet buys.

- Go to the token and sort the maker by the wallet you’re trying to copy.

- If the wallet is among the first 3 seconds, you are likely copying a sniper.

- This strategy can be extremely unsuccessful.

3. Copy Trade does not work, troubleshooting:

- Confirm you’ve activated the copy trade module by clicking ➕Add.

- Confirm you have the appropriate target wallet set up

- Review Solscan.io to ensure your target wallet is trading in supported pools.

- Supported pools: Raydium AMM, CLMM, Meteora and Jupiter Routed Trades.

- Unsupported pools: Directly through ORCA or FluxPools

- Check solscan.io to ensure you are not copying a sniper or custom program.

- Open a buy transaction in legacy mode.

- If you see “Interact with System Program” you cannot copy this wallet.

- Only copying sells? Review for custom program in a buy tx.

4. Why can’t I copy a sniper?

- Proper snipers bots spam 100s to 1000s of tx's and cannot be copied.

- Snipers often leverage custom programs that cannot be copied.

Note: IF you find a sniper you can copy, remember you are exit liquidity:

- they buy first block

- you buy the top of the sniper candle

- Sniper dumps massively

- You sell the absolute bottom.

5. Why can’t I copy a custom program?

- we don't support copy trading custom programs, because they can be malicious and fake swaps in order to exploit copy trading bots.

- it is likely if you’re copying an individual using a custom program to buy, you will copy sells because they are selling directly through a copiable setup.

6. Failed to Send transaction (when selling):

- Ensure you have not been blacklisted/frozen (rugged) by checking your token account on solscan.io.

1. Go to your wallet on Solscan.io

2. Click portfolio

3. Find the token you’re looking for

4. Click through to the account.

5. Top right see if the account is frozen

- Not enough tokens on your balance to sell

- Sale initiated by your copied trader before your buy has been completed

title: How to setup Copy Trade
body:
To setup Copy Trade you need to have a wallet (trader) you want to Copy Trade, then you can head to main menu (type /start) and click on "Copy Trade".

  1. Here you have a overview of wallets you copy trade and you can manage or add new wallets to copy trade.

  2. To add a wallet to Copy Trade click "New", click on "Target Wallet" and enter the wallet you want to copy trade, press on "Tag" and give name to this wallet.

Note: Make sure you don't add Custom Programs, Snipers or Bots. It only works for normal wallets.

3. Enable "Copy Sells" to copy sells of your trader

Note: Once enabled, you sell the same % of your bag whenever the target wallet sells the same % of his bag.

4. Enter the "Buy Percentage" in % that you wish to copy for the target wallet or choose own amount.

5. Specify "Buy Gas" and "Sell Gas" priority tip.

title: What is a DCA Buy Order?
description: This article details setting up a DCA Buy Order on Trojan, including its automated execution at set intervals and price conditions.
body:
Understanding a DCA Buy Order:

A DCA (Dollar Cost Averaging) Buy Order is an automated trading mechanism designed to gradually establish a position. On the Trojan platform, DCA orders are executed at preset intervals based on the market price for a specified duration, provided the minimum and maximum price or market cap parameters are met.

Execution: When an order is triggered during one of the set intervals, it executes at the current market price.

Purpose: DCA orders automate the buying process at regular intervals within your specified price range, aligning with your trading strategy and eliminating the need to manually place each order.

title: Troubleshooting Lag Issues on Your Bot
body:
Troubleshooting Lag with Trojan Bots:

  1. Switch to a Bot with Less Load:

    • Enter the command /backup in any Trojan bot.

    • Select a bot with a green indicator 🟢, which signifies lighter load and typically offers a better performance.

  2. If Lag Persists, Perform Basic Checks and Maintenance:

    • Clear Telegram Cache:

      • iOS: Go to Settings > Data and Storage > Storage Usage > Clear Cache.

      • Android: Go to Settings > Storage Usage > Clear Cache.

    • Force Close the Telegram App.

    • Delete Messages in Your Chat with the Bot.

  3. Re-Evaluate Bot Performance:

    • Revisit any Trojan bot and use the /backup command again to assess and connect to the best performing bot.

title: Can I modify existing orders?
body:
To modify an active DCA or Limit Order, you need to follow these steps:

Close the Existing Order:

Navigate to the Main Menu by typing /start in the chat.

Click on either "DCA Orders" or "Limit Orders" depending on the type of order you wish to modify.

Select the order you want to change and click "Close" to terminate it.

Create a New Order with Updated Parameters:

After closing the existing order, set up a new order.

During this setup, you can specify new parameters, such as a different amount, duration, or other settings that suit your updated needs.


​

title: My DCA Order is executing a different amount.
body:
DCA Buy Orders:

With a Specified Duration:

Example: If you set a total amount of 1 SOL for a DCA Buy Order with a 10-minute duration and 1-minute intervals, the amount is divided evenly across each interval.

Details: For this setup, there are 10 intervals, so each interval involves purchasing 0.1 SOL.

Without a Specified Duration:

Example: For an amount of 1 SOL with 1-minute intervals but no set end duration, 1 SOL will be purchased at each interval until you choose to close the order.

DCA Sell Orders:

With a Specified Duration:

Example: If you set the order to sell 50% of your tokens over a duration of 10 minutes with 1-minute intervals, the percentage is distributed equally across each interval.

Details: There are 10 intervals, so each interval involves selling 5% of the tokens.

Without a Specified Duration:

Example: For a 50% sell amount with 1-minute intervals and no end duration, 50% of the tokens will be sold at each interval until all tokens are sold.

Key Points to Remember:

In DCA Buy Orders, the total amount set is allocated per interval, whether the duration is specified or not.

In DCA Sell Orders, the percentage set is divided across the intervals if a duration is specified, or executed fully at each interval if no duration is set.

title: My Limit Orders fill price is different from my trigger point.
body:
Market Price Execution:

Limit Orders are executed at the Market Price once triggered. Because market prices can fluctuate rapidly, there might be a difference between your trigger point and the actual fill price.

Impact of Slippage Settings:

The variance in fill price is influenced by the slippage settings you select. Slippage allows for a price range within which your order can be executed to ensure it fills despite market movements.

Example:

Suppose you set a slippage of 10%. If your order triggers at a price of $1, the fill price could be as low as $0.90 or as high as $1.10. This range accommodates the potential price fluctuation at the time of execution.

Market Volatility and MEV Protection:

If you experience a significant disparity between the trigger price and the fill price, it could be due to high market volatility or the absence of MEV (Miner Extractable Value) Protection. Without MEV Protection, your transaction could be vulnerable to being "front-run" by MEV bots, which prioritize their transactions in the order queue, potentially affecting your order’s execution price.

title: DCA Orders
body:
Accessing DCA Orders:

Start by opening the Main Menu in the chat. You can do this by typing /start.

Look for and select the "DCA Orders" option. If this option isn't visible, you'll need to enable it by:

Going to Settings.

Scrolling to the bottom and clicking on Advanced Mode. This action switches from Simple Mode to Advanced Mode, revealing all available features, including DCA Orders.

Viewing and Managing DCA Orders:

To manage your DCA Orders, return to the Main Menu by typing /start again.

Select "DCA Orders" to see and adjust your active DCA Orders. Here, you can review each order's interval, minimum and maximum price, and expiration details.

Modifying DCA Orders:

To change a specific DCA order, simply choose the order you wish to update and close it or make the necessary modifications.

If you need to cancel all existing orders and start afresh, select the "Close All" option to terminate all active DCA Orders.

title: Limit Orders
body:
Accessing Limit Orders:

Begin by navigating to the Main Menu. You can do this by typing /start in the chat.

From the Main Menu, select the "Limit Orders" option. If you do not see this option, follow the steps below to enable it:

Go to Settings.

Scroll down and select Advanced Mode at the bottom. This will switch your interface from Simple Mode to Advanced Mode, allowing you to access all features, including Limit Orders.

Viewing and Managing Limit Orders:

Return to the Main Menu by typing /start.

Click on "Limit Orders" to view and manage your active limit orders. Here, you can check each order's trigger price and expiration date.

Modifying Limit Orders:

To alter an existing limit order, select the specific order you wish to change and choose to either close it or modify as needed.

If you wish to close all active limit orders at once, use the "Close All" option.

title: What is a DCA Sell Order?
body:
Understanding a DCA Sell Order:

A DCA (Dollar Cost Averaging) Sell Order is an automated trading mechanism designed to gradually exit a position. On the Trojan platform, DCA orders are executed at preset intervals based on the market price for a specified duration, provided the minimum and maximum price or market cap parameters are met.

Execution: When an order is triggered during one of the set intervals, it executes at the current market price.

Purpose: DCA orders automate the selling process at regular intervals within your specified price range, aligning with your trading strategy and eliminating the need to manually place each order and to decrease impact off your sells by selling gradually.

title: What is a Limit Sell Order?
body:
Understanding a Limit Sell Order:

A Limit Sell Order is an automated transaction that activates at a specific Trigger Price or market cap and executes at the current market price. This order type is ideal for selling an asset at a predetermined price point or market cap value, allowing you to set your target sell conditions in advance. It offers greater control over your trading activities by eliminating the need to continuously monitor price fluctuations to hit a desired exit point.

title: Limit Sell Order
body:
How to Place a Limit Sell Order

Initiating a Limit Order:

From the main menu, select "Sell".

Entering Token Details:

Choose token you want to sell.

Setting Up the Order:

After accessing the token information, select "✅ Limit" to initiate a Limit Order.

Choose a predefined % amount or select "X % ✏️" to enter a custom amount.

Opt for the standard slippage setting or customize it by selecting "X Slippage ✏️".

Set the Trigger Price/mcap and Expiry using the format guidelines provided by the bot.

Stop Loss - trigger Price/mcap below current price/mcap or -x% change

Take Profit - trigger Price/mcap above current price/mcap or x% change

Completing the Order:

Once all necessary parameters are set, click on "Create Order".

A success message "🟢 Limit order placed!" will confirm the creation of your Limit order.

Managing Limit Orders:

To view or manage your Limit orders, go to the main menu and select "Limit Orders".
